item.title: MCDuncanLab
item.description:
@albertcardona
@albertcardona To me, scientific misconduct makes a lot of sense. Just like it makes sense that a subcontractor would use a smaller gauge wire than is optimal if it saves money or that a grocery store clerk would fail to rotate stock if no one was looking...when there is pay or less work involved, some people will try to cheat. Science is no different. If you own a construction firm or a grocery store, you need to ensure people are doing it right, not different in science.

item.title: Nicole Rust
item.description:
How did John Hopfield decide to work on the topic that led to his Nobel Prize? "I was now looking for A PROBLEM, not a problem ... How mind emerges from brain is to me the deepest question posed by our humanity. Definitely A PROBLEM."More here:
https://pni.princeton.edu/people/john-j-hopfield/now-whatThe solution:
https://www.pnas.org/doi/abs/10.1073/pnas.79.8.2554"In the model network each "neuron" has elementary properties, and the network has little structure. Nonetheless, collective computational properties spontaneously arose."
